intro: Lippia lacunosa, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southern United States and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, slightly minty leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported digestive and antimicrobial properties. Lippia lacunosa is also a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and fragrance.
